reviewText: If you like platformers, this game is a no-brainer. It is a complete and total upgrade to Rayman Origins, which is a great game itself. Pretty much everything that could have been improved, has been improved. The controls are really tight and I never encountered frustating or unfair passages in the game. The new cover songs-themed levels are really enjoyable and satisfying as well and I really wish the game had more of those. If you are not sure about buying the game, get Rayman Origins instead. It gives you a good idea of the game mechanics and it's a bit cheaper.\nHowever, Rayman Origins is not required to enjoy Legends, because there is no continuous story across games and a decent amount of levels from Origins are available to play in Legends.

reviewText: So I rarely write reviews, but I'm being entirely sincere here. This is one of the best games I've ever played, which is insane considering it's genre. It is so much fun, very pleasing and fulfilling game. I highly recommend you buy this. I got it in a sale, but 40$ still feels worth it considering you get legends and origins.

An excellent platformer. The entire game is very polished, with smooth animations and responsive controls. The painting art style of this sequel is even better than the already-gorgeous Rayman Origins.

I really love this platformer game.  The levels are challenging but not impossible, and makes the right choice to have there be varying rewards based on how well you do, rather than make every level a pass/fail.

One of the best parts of it is that there's no real penalty for dying.  Other players can just shoot you, and you're back.  This means that I can play it with my 5 year old and 7 year old, and we all have fun.  Sure, I'm getting most of the lums, but they're having a blast, too.

I'm not as big a fan of the challenges.  They're repetitive, and I felt like I was grinding out my million lums by the end.  There's also the problem that there are so many cheaters that a platinum result in the challenges is basically impossible, so it makes it an even longer grind.

By far the biggest problem, though, is the lack of multiple saves.  I couldn't play my own game, and then start over again with my kids.  If you want to start over, you need to delete your entire save.  That means multiple people can't really have their own games.  It's a huge flaw, and something the first game didn't do.

Score: 8.5/10

After having completed the unlockable content of the game and being just 30 Lums away from 100% completion, it's time to rate this game. What can I say...:
It's the best freaking Jump'n Run ever (on Steam)!

The artstyle, the gameplay, the character design, the music, the varying leveldesigns (rhythmbased, flight, speedrun, typical sidecroll levels etc)... It's so well-done, I can't think of anything the developers could have improved.
The game has no online coop, but that is understandable, one little lagspike WILL kill you, because the more challenging levels are hell. At least the couch coop is absolutely great and makes the game more challenging (prepare to be trolled).
Don't even bother trying to get the gold medals in leaderboard extra challenges, it's impossible!
One important info: If you are a fan of the series like I am; Rayman Legends' best levels (I played them all on Wii) are also available in this game besides other unlocks which I won't spoil.

One minus point for obligatory UPlay, but still a big recommendation; even Snoop Dogg likes it! ^^

I paid about $10 for it and it took me about 6 hours to finish. That 6 hours is only playing through the Rayman Legends levels, not the levels from Rayman Origins which are unlockable in this game.
If you don't like this game, you don't like vidya.\n\nDon't speak to me if you don't like this game. Ever.

Rayman is an interesting fella. He doesn't have a neck or limbs, but that doesn't prevent him from being a platform household name. His first game back in 1995 was full of original gameplay concepts that kept you hooked, despite the game's brutal difficulty. The game was such as succes that sequels followed after a few years. As great as those were, they were subject to the '3D rule' that departed from the classic side-scrolling worlds of old and offered 3D worlds instead.

After the succes of games like New Super Mario Bros. in recent years, many platformer series started to explore the good old realm of 2D platforming again, a realm lost somewhere in the late 90s. Rayman did it with the fantastic Rayman Origins (also on Steam, check it out if you have not already). Origins was a welcome game in 2011, as we hadn't really seen Ubisoft's mascot in a while. It was an old-fashioned 2D platformer like the 1995 classic, but also brought in elements from the 3D sequels. What Origins did better than many games in the new generation of sidescrollers, though, was that it also had new additions to the series of its own.

Other genre icons often kept innovation limited to 3D games, using the 2D entries to provide a nostalgic feel of familiarity. Origins was different. It was quirkier, more experimental, more anarchic in both gameplay and visuals, while also remaining true to its 90s roots.

Building from the same engine as Origins, Legends controls and feels very similar to its predecessor, yet somehow it also manages to feel fresh. What makes it so fun is that each level feels different and new gameplay elements are contstantly added, adding additional depth to the cleverly designed levels. At one point you're jumping through the desert along the beat of 'Eye of the Tiger' while later you might find yourself running vertically along a wall being chased by dragons. For a true fun fest you can gather some friends around and play cooperatively. Too bad there's still no online mode for this.

This is especially painful when you notice how big and robust of a package Legends otherwise is. There's plenty of  unlockable characters, which unfortunately have very little variation in both appearance and gameplay. More interesting are the levels you can unlock. Additional levels are unlocked if you collect more fairies and free more Teensies (your friends). The game has new weekly challenges to satisfy even ardent platform fans. The game even throws in a selection of the best levels from Origins as an unlockable extra. These are tweaked just so that you don't quite get the same experience as in the previous game.

The presentation is even better than in Origins. While I found that game to be one of the prettiest I ever played, Legends is even more detailed and dynamic than its predecessor, without changing much in terms of Rayman's distinct style. I could not have imagined a 2D game even more stunning than Origins, but Legends somehow manages it. Legends truly shows that there's really no limit to what can be achieved with today's 2D graphics in HD resolutions. The musical score is gorgeous and fully orchestrated. The tunes are a little similar, even when compared with Origins. There could have been a little more variety. Still, this is a soundtrack with a level of quality that most platformers don't have, just like in 1995.

Rayman Legends is just sheer fun, especially with friends. While not a drastic departure from the already impressive Origins, Legends still manages to provide a bigger, more polished package. If you can look past the lack of variety in characters or the lack of an online coop mode, there's is simply no better side-scrolling platformer available at the moment. This is the combination of art direction, gameplay and creativity that is rare in the genre these days. Rayman could just have taken the easy route and use the 'retro IS the appeal' mantra so common these days. Instead, Rayman Legends is also a modern game at the same time. Don't waste your time and money on the latest same old New Super Mario Bros. Rayman is where it's really at right now. Sorry, Nintendo, but Ubisoft beats you where you used to excel.

9,5/10

VERDICT Buy Now (9.6/10)
Completion Time: 20-25 hours
Bottom Line: This game is quite simply the best. Rayman is at it again"

Rayman Legends is a very fun 2D platformer. If you enjoy the 2D Mario games you'll really like this. You get new moves as the game progresses that add to the gameplay and keep things fresh. It starts out fairly easy but some of the later levels are very challenging even for veteran players. It never really felt cheap or frustrating though, which is good. I paid about $10 for it and it took me about 6 hours to finish. That 6 hours is only playing through the Rayman Legends levels, not the levels from Rayman Origins which are unlockable in this game.

The perfect sequel? They kept Origins' controls and happy vibe, but everything else is just better. You only have to jump on enemies once, there are more characters to play as, and there's an *actually fun* online mode. I've been lucky with Uplay so far‚Äîno problems yet. If you liked Origins, and maybe even if you didn't, this is the game for you.

So I rarely write reviews, but I'm being entirely sincere here. This is one of the best games I've ever played, which is insane considering it's genre. An excellent platformer. The entire game is very polished, with smooth animations and responsive controls. The painting art style of this sequel is even better than the already-gorgeous Rayman Origins.

I really love this platformer game.  The levels are challenging but not impossible, and makes the right choice to have there be varying rewards based on how well you do, rather than make every level a pass/fail.

One of the best parts of it is that there's no real penalty for dying.  Other players can just shoot you, and you're back.  This means that I can play it with my 5 year old and 7 year old, and we all have fun.  Sure, I'm getting most of the lums, but they're having a blast, too.

I'm not as big a fan of the challenges.  They're repetitive, and I felt like I was grinding out my million lums by the end.  There's also the problem that there are so many cheaters that a platinum result in the challenges is basically impossible, so it makes it an even longer grind.

By far the biggest problem, though, is the lack of multiple saves.  I couldn't play my own game, and then start over again with my kids.  If you want to start over, you need to delete your entire save.  That means multiple people can't really have their own games.  It's a huge flaw, and something the first game didn't do.

As somebody who has always sucked at video games, but loved them nonetheless, Rayman Legends is a brilliant, entertaining, imaginative, fun and sometimes frustrating game.

Pros
-Beautiful and well-designed environments and characters
-An enormous amount of content
-A really great soundtrack (with surprise musical levels, which I just love)
-Easy enough for a squirt like me but also enough to keep you on your toes
-Daily and weekly challenges, for those who are into that
-Great multiplayer
-Controls feel slick and well-done, never left feeling like the controller is letting me down

Cons
-Does play through Uplay, but tbh it's definitely worth it
-No achievments (again, earned through Uplay)

A really great game that seriously can't be missed.

I love this game and its graphics. it is simply beautiful. So much fun to play! However getting it started was kind of a pain. I didnt have a Uplay account prior to buying this game (ive always played it on the Wii U, which is SO awesome!). Once you create an account with them (Uplay) in order to get the game started you have to have a game key. Well to save you some time and aggravation, once you have downloaded the game look underneath your DLC and youll see that the game key has been installed and then cick on that to copy the game key to the Uplay window that prompts you for said game key. Then you should be good to go. Im new to that whole process with having to download a game like that, so it might have been the obvious thing to do but for someone who has never had to do anything like that before it was aggravating.  It was worth it though. This is a great game for any kind of gamer on any skill level!

This game is a joy to players new and old to the Rayman games. It has great controller support and can customize each key/button individually for great comfort if you are used to, say, jumping in Skyrim you can change it to that button/key. The beginning courses are great for easing you into the style and mechanics of the game.

Bugs galore!I spent almost 2 hours trying to fix the bugs so that I would actually be able to play. However the bugs are completely game breaking. The game constantly drops to 30FPS which literally locks the game in slow motion mode. There is also an extreme screen tearing in fullscreen mode, with and without v-sync.

This is a prime example of how lazy developers can be. Absolutely no patches!

So many people have praised this game as one of the best platformers of modern times". The little I got to actually played was marvelous. However I ended up with doing the only right thing. I uninstalled it :( I hope that one day they will release a patch to fix this amazing game. Until then
date: I will not stick around. Sorry

reviewText:
This game has by far the best artwork I have seen for a long long time in a video game.
The level design is great, the music is great, and the musical levels are a delight.

If you like platformers, you will love Rayman Legends. By far one of the best 2D platformers I have seen for a long time.
The best platform game what i ever play :)
Never to old to laugh or platform!
brilliant game , very well made , the music levels are great

After having completed the unlockable content of the game and being just 30 Lums away from 100% completion, it's time to rate this game. What can I say...:
It's the best freaking Jump'n Run ever (on Steam)!

The artstyle, the gameplay, the character design, the music, the varying leveldesigns (rhythmbased, flight, speedrun, typical sidecroll levels etc)... It's so well-done, I can't think of anything the developers could have improved.
The game has no online coop, but that is understandable, one little lagspike WILL kill you, because the more challenging levels are hell. At least the couch coop is absolutely great and makes the game more challenging (prepare to be trolled).
Don't even bother trying to get the gold medals in leaderboard extra challenges, it's impossible!
One important info: If you are a fan of the series like I am; Rayman Legends' best levels (I played them all on Wii) are also available in this game besides other unlocks which I won't spoil.

One minus point for obligatory UPlay, but still a big recommendation; even Snoop Dogg likes it! ^^
9/10

The perfect sequel? They kept Origins' controls and happy vibe, but everything else is just better. You only have to jump on enemies once, there are more characters to play as, and there's an *actually fun* online mode. I've been lucky with Uplay so far‚Äîno problems yet. If you liked Origins, and maybe even if you didn't, this is the game for you.

So I rarely write reviews, but I'm being entirely sincere here. This is one of the best games I've ever played, which is insane considering it's genre. It is so much fun, very pleasing and fulfilling game. I highly recommend you buy this. I got it in a sale, but 40$ still feels worth it considering you get legends and origins.
Very fun game highly recommended for platform lovers.

As noted in my Rayman Origin's review, this game and its predecessor are two of the best platforming games to come out in recent years, far superior to Nintendo's Mario offerings.\nHowever this one, unlike Origin's, suffers a fault - one that is almost unforgivable. This was originally a Wii-U game, utilizing the touch-pad on the Wii-U for certain segments of the game. In this PC port, these segments still exist - rather than redesign the level to be more fun platforming sections, instead they ham-fistedly added a press Y to do a thing" function that makes these sections occasionally fiddly and tedious.\nOther than that
date: this is more of the same (quite literally
recommended: as a good few dozen of Origin's levels make it into this one too as a bonus). Excellent music
hoursPlayed: theming and platforming. Highly recommend either of the recent Rayman games for any fans of platformers."

reviewText: Rayman Legends is a very fun 2D platformer. If you enjoy the 2D Mario games you'll really like this. You get new moves as the game progresses that add to the gameplay and keep things fresh. It starts out fairly easy but some of the later levels are very challenging even for veteran players. It never really felt cheap or frustrating though, which is good. I paid about $10 for it and it took me about 6 hours to finish. That 6 hours is only playing through the Rayman Legends levels, not the levels from Rayman Origins which are unlockable in this game.

Fun platformer although I haven't played many of the older rayman games so my review is limited to just this game.
Pros
Lots of collectables
lots of levels
Weekly and daily challenges
multiple characters to play as

My favorite levels were the music ones especially the ones in the last level.

Cons
may come off as too easy

main game finished in 8 hours, but only got about 2/3 of the collectables
Best platformer on steam!

+++ Fantastic art direction
+++ Simple yet expansive controls that do a lot, with just a little
+++ Healthy difficulty curve that culminates into a solid challenge without being overly frustrating
+++ Varied levels each with their own special mechanic or focus
--- Floaty controls, especially on narrow platforms
--- Boss fights built on trial and error

Rayman Legends is 'the' definitive modern platformer of the era.  It offers a clean experience without being too pure, it's loaded with goodies without getting bloated under the weight, and it stands out with its own signature rather than rely excessively on classic gaming references and nostalgia (excluding the 8-bit levels of course.)  The game is just right, just plain fun, and it never outstays its welcome.  A rare example of its kind, it's a delight for the casual and the hardcore alike.
Yes.

I got to be honest, as goofy and childish this might seem, Rayman Legends is probably the most fun I've had with a videogame in years. The platformer action is fast-paced and at some points, really challenging and the collectibles are plentiful. If I had to say one thing that's truly amazing, it's the music. I can't help but whistle it anytime, anywhere.

I simply cannot reccomend this game enough! In fact, this game reminded me of the exact reason why I got into video games in the first place. It is just pure fun and amazement, constantly showing innovative and creative ideas. Every single level adds something new to the table and the mechanics are refined and polished. The reward system is great as well, giving you the incentive to keep on trying for that high score, or trophy, or extra levels. It's a simple shame that this game does not have any steam support (besides launching in Uplay, a terrible DRM system by ubisoft) so I cannot see all the many achievments I would have wracked up. However there is a sort of online vs play with scores, and if you enjoyed a game like dustforce for that aspect I could see you enjoying this as well. Bottom line is: buy it for single player or buy it for multiplayer, but if you like sidescrolling platformers, fun action, and incredible visuals and music there is no reason for you not to have this game.

Loads of fun, especially playing couch co-op with friends.  I loved Rayman Origins, and I'm tempted to say this is the better game, overall.  The level design is both more creative and flows a lot better than Origins, even when it was at its best.  I'm also glad they replaced the time-trial challenges for each level with specific speed-run challenge levels.  My least favorite part of Origins were those timed runs -- the base levels really weren't designed for speedrunning, so trying to beat them in a set time limit without dying was more awkward and frustrating than challenging or fun.  The speed-run challenge levels here are short and play almost like platforming rhythm puzzles.  Speaking of rhythm -- the music levels are amazing!  By far the most memorable part of the game, and they add a lot of anticipation as you work to unlock them.  It's also one of the most beautiful games I've ever played.  The special effects, shaders, and 3D assets meld perfectly with the overall 2D aesthetic.  I wish more games looked and played this well!
I ran forward.\n\nBest game.

I love the game (espacially the Back to Origins, which has levels from the first Rayman game I ever had).  It's beautiful, the music is great, and it's not too easy or hard.  My greatest love of the series is that it's always so silly!\nMy one complaint is, and I don't know if this had to do with uPlay or my fault or what-have-you, but I 99.99%-ed the game (I got every character except Rayomz) but then when my computer broke, I went to play on my new one and my progress was all lost!  For other games though, like Super Meat Boy, it saves progress from device to device.\nAside from my bad experience, I highly reccommend this game.
Must have
